page.title: 19BROXBOURNEBURY/THE PARK
page.content: Originally the Broxbournebury estate was 1600 acres. Today a Special School the building stands in 80 acres of parkland & woods with 2 lakes. Fishing rights for carp, tench etc. are held by the Council. In the grounds stable cottages, a 4 flat stable conversion, a huntsman's cottage, the South Lodge & 2 modern houses are used by staff, etc. The schoolchildren enjoy the estate especially their adventure playground and the woods where an ice- house deep in a frost hollow, formerly used to store venison, etc. is now used as a 'hidey' place ! Local schools hold their District Sports & Rounders Competitions in the grounds & Guides enjoy camping too. Once a year over 3000 people visit to enjoy the Extravaganza, a fund raising fete for the School, when sideshows, amuse- ments & picnics make a happy day !
